title: What are some examples of modern teaching strategies? - Quora

response.answer_text: Some teaching strategies have been around since the development of the modern education system (think cooperative learning and math puzzles) but others are uniquely suited to address modern classrooms. Blended learning combines online learning with traditional classroom instruction. Students in a blended learning program take certain courses entirely online, and develop technology skills alongside traditional academic ones. There are a number of different ways to bring blended learning to your classroom, but some common methods include implementing learning stations and putting certain lessons online in part or entirely.Media literacy gives students the skills to recognize bias and use critical thinking within the context of classroom subjects. In English class, students can examine and analyze advertising language in magazines and online advertisements or look for bias in popular news articles.Culturally responsive teaching links content from the classroom with student’s contemporary and ancestral cultures. Including different perspectives in your classroom engages all students and makes them feel empowered. Create relevant word problems, promote positive media portrayals, make sure your classroom materials feature diverse voices and get to know your students.That’s just three, but there are lots more. Check out The Ultimate List of Teaching Strategies for a list of 36 teaching strategies, old and new.
